casebody.data:
STANDARD FRUIT COMPANY, Appellant, v. SKIBS A/S AWILCO, Appellee. No. 20768. United States Court of Appeals Fifth Circuit. Feb. 17, 1964. William S. Stone, Deutsch, Kerrigan & Stiles; New Orleans, La., Robert M. Moore, René S. Paysse, New Orleans, La., of counsel, for appellant. Benjamin W. Yancey, Walter Carroll, Jr., and Terriberry, Rault, Carroll, Yan-cey & Farrell, New Orleans, La., Haight, Gardner, Poor & Havens, New York City, for appellee.

Before CAMERON, WISDOM, and GEWIN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

We have considered carefully all of the appellant’s contentions. We agree with the district court’s interpretation of the charter party and with his conclusions of law. After a careful study of the record, as a whole, we have concluded that substantial evidence supports the findings of the district court.

The judgment is affirmed.
